Quiz App

I have a passion for teaching and learning. So when I was getting comfortable with React, I decided to put myself in the shoes of an instructor who wished to test his students online. I developed this app from scratch using React and the Context API. Although itâ€™s simple, it required some deep thought, especially when I had to maintain a unified state throughout the app.

TYPE

Web Stack and Explanation

React and the Context API made it straightforward to develop this app. It needed a single source of truth, which the Context API provided. And React combined with React Router made navigation a breeze.

Problems and Thought Process

Aside from exercises from tutorials and some personal React challenges that I come up with, this quiz app is my first React project. The most challenging part was maintaining states across different pages. But once I figured it out, I started to appreciate React and its popularity.

Also, Tailwind CSS made it easy to style the components without caring about class overrides.

Lessons Learned

This project was an eye-opener in my React journey. It helped me understand the use cases of core React Hooks, including useState and useEffect. I also learned how React Router v6 works and how to use the Context API.
